hero.headline: Calm, client-led, ICF-aligned coaching for real transitions.
hero.subheadline: Grounded space to regroup, experiment, and move forward on your terms.
hero.imageAlt: Notebook, tea, and sunlight suggesting a calm coaching space.

forWhom.title: Who we work with
forWhom.intro: Four contexts we meet every week. Each link shows the service structure, boundaries, and fees.

cards.title: Transition coaching
cards.description: Settle into the UK while honouring commitments elsewhere. Sessions help you map choices without rushing decisions.

cards.title: Early career clarity
cards.description: Try options safely before you commit. We reality-check offers, mentors, and experiments you design.

cards.title: Working parent support
cards.audience: For parents and carers rebuilding rhythm.
cards.description: Re-enter work without losing the care agreements that matter. Expect honest planning, not hustle culture.

cards.title: Cross-cultural leadership
cards.audience: For managers across borders and teams.
cards.description: Lead with clarity across cultures and expectations. We practise conversations and boundaries that protect your capacity.

recognise.title: You might recognise this
items: You moved to the UK and are unsure which workplace norms to follow.
You want to return to work without losing the care agreements that matter at home.
You speak multiple languages yet hesitate when conversations turn fast or nuanced.
You are balancing visas, family expectations, and your own leadership plans.
You sense burnout signals and want to experiment before things fracture.

how.title: How coaching works
how.intro: A simple rhythm that loops as your focus evolves.

steps.title: Arrive with what is real
steps.summary: We start with the situation you name—no scripts, no pressure to have it figured out.

steps.title: Explore options with consent
steps.summary: You test language, stories, and experiments while we hold structure and ask sharper questions.

steps.title: Design what happens next
steps.summary: We close each session with actions, supports, or referrals you choose to carry forward.

how.ownership: You are always in charge of pace and topic. Our role is to hold structure, flag boundaries, and ask better questions.
how.ctaLabel: Read how coaching works in detail

realLife.title: In real life, this often sounds like…
realLife.intro: Composite scenarios drawn from different clients so privacy stays protected.

items.quote: “I’ve moved to the UK and feel I’m starting from zero while my family still needs support back home.”
“I lead a small team and I’m tired of being ‘on’ all the time for everyone else.”
“I’m re-entering work after care leave and want a plan that respects both income and my capacity.”

realLife.disclaimer: These are blended examples, not single-client testimonials. They show the types of topics we can explore together.

faqSection.title: Before we meet
faqSection.body: You can self-check scope, logistics, and ethics any time.
bullets: Understand how coaching differs from therapy or consulting.
See typical session rhythms, frequency, and fee ranges.
Know what happens if mental health or safeguarding needs appear.
faqSection.summary: Use the FAQ to get practical answers before you book. It helps you decide whether to start, pause, or request a referral.
